Treatment with MSA/mir-1291 (20 nM) led to a 1.2- and 1.4-fold increase in ARID3B mRNA levels in PANC-1 cells, as compared to MSA or vehicle control, at 48 h and 72 h post-treatment, respectively (FIG. 27D).
Similarly, MSA/mir-1291 (5 nM) caused a 4.7-fold and 3.2-fold upregulation of ARID3B mRNA levels in AsPC-1 cells (FIG. 27D), at 48 h and 72 h post-treatment, respectively.
Our data showed that ARID3B-FL protein levels increased around 50% in PANC-1 cells at 72 h post-transfection with 20 nM miR-1291 prodrug.
A higher degree of increase of ARID3B-FL protein levels was found in AsPC-1 cells at both 48 h (80%) and 72 h (200%) post-treatment with 5 nM miR-1291.
Individual and combined actions of miR-1291 prodrug (10 nM in PANC-1 cells, 3 nM in AsPC-1 cells) and Gem-nP on their corresponding target or marker proteins were first investigated in PANC-1 and AsPC-1 cells by Western blots (FIG. 29B-C).
